intro: Hieracium hecatadenum, commonly known as the greater hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which are often covered in fine, glandular hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and other open habitats. Hieracium hecatadenum is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
